description: Borrowed from French pétiole, and its source, Late Latin petiolus (“little foot”), diminutive form of Latin pēs (“foot”).

entries.meaning: (botany) The stalk of a leaf, attaching the blade to the stem.
(entomology, insect anatomy) A narrow or constricted segment of the body of an insect; especially, the metasomal segment of certain Hymenoptera, such as wasps.
examples: Synonym: pedicel (used more generally, of arthropods)

entries.meaning: (entomology) The stalk at the base of the nest of the paper wasp.
